newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks quiet in London, Swire gains.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks quiet in London, Swire gains.

text.p: Shares in Swire Pacific A gained ground on Wednesday in an otherwise quiet session for Hong Kong stocks in London,dealers said.

Dealers said Swire Pacific A jumped HK$1.85 to HK$58.60 in London, following a statement that its Swire Properties Ltd and Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd's New Town had acquired the right to develop a steel mill site in Hong Kong.
Shares in Sun Hung Kai Properties gained 12-1/2 HK cents to close at HK$81.125.
The Hang Seng London Reference index closed up 7.07 points at 12,714.11, extending the one percent rise in the Hang Seng earlier on Wednesday.
Dealers said Hong Kong banks had featured earlier in the London session but had fallen as Wall Sreet opened weaker and U.S. Treasury bond prices fell.
HSBC Holdings closed down 25 HK cents at HK$189.25.
-- Andrew Langlands, London Newsroom +44 171 542 3496 (c) Reuters Limited 1997
